basics.name: Leah-Mei Villanueva
basics.label: Alumni
basics.summary: I am Bachelor of Science in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I graduated in Fall 2020.

work.company: UH Manoa Department of Urban and Regional Planning
work.summary: Assists Graduate Students' Department of Urban and Regional Planning in dealing with confidential paperwork, which may include check requests and faculty/student documents.
highlights: Respond to incoming calls and respond to emails
Have skill in using XEROX machine
Assist with correspondence, file, prepare federal reports (duplicate, type, graphics, etc.), use word processor.

volunteer.summary: Assisted American Savings Bank Seeds of Service with the beautification of A'ala Park. My team was in charge of painting the lightpoles and painting over grafitti
Assisted children participants to prepare for their turn to present their lemonade stands and drinks to the judges.
highlights: Maintain a healthy relationship with the children

volunteer.summary: Assisted children with disabilities to create paper turkies for Thanksgiving. We also had extra time to play other fun activities, like soccer
highlights: Helping disabled children create arts and crafts for Thanksgiving
Collaborating with college students as a high school student

volunteer.summary: Made arts and crafts with geriatric patients and played bingo
highlights: Making bowl maracas with the geriatric patients
Collaborating with college students as a high school student
Seeing the smiles on the patients' grow

volunteer.summary: Assisted the American Savings Bank seeds of services to clean up A'ala Park. My team was in charge of picking up the trash surrounding the area.
Beautification of University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Raked leaves and pulled weeds out

volunteer.summary: Decorated a ballroom and the Hawaii Convention Center for Boogie Wonderland

awards.title: CTE Honors
awards.summary: The Career and Technical Education Honors Recognition Certificate (CTE) was given to students who passed Biology with a B grade or higher and completed the given project from their career pathway program

awards.title: Academic Honors
awards.summary: I completed 4 credits of math and science and 2 credits of college level courses in high school
